column314: The Pacific is one of the areas that is falling off the philanthropic map and it needs to be prioritised. A scoping study in 2019 commissioned by UAF A&P and Women's Fund Fiji found that less than 1% of grant funding is directed to women's organisations in the Pacific. PFF hopes to change this.

column290: Help in Capacity development and organization system strengthening, and Funds to finance core activities
column291: Requesting funders to consider weak but strong-willed struggling feminist groups with flexible funding to build their capacity to enhance the feminist agenda.
column313: WODEF would spend money on Capacity building, Systems strengthening, and in financing core programme activities such as Advocacy, Economic , Health, Response to crisis and Education/training.
column314: We really appreciate this research and we strongly feel it’s such a great opportunity offered to us to share our experiences. We feel appreciated and heard. WODEF has not been funded before but we have a strong desire and determination to find ways of acquiring resources to support our course in South Nyanza region, Kenya.  We have had challenges in preparing winning proposals to acquire resources that we need to fulfill our aspirations of adding to the global efforts of advancing women’s rights and support. However, we have been trying to prepare and send out proposals which we strongly pray to be responded to one day.  Our spirit has always been pushing for the feminist agenda from grassroot level even with no or little resources until we reach our desired destination. We need support in Capacity building, and connections to potential donors who can help us join hands with the larger community of feminist groups/organizations/movements working across the African continent.
